Key Match Events: Mookie Betts homered for the second straight night.
Shohei Ohtani hit an RBI single.
Will Smith and Gavin Lux each hit a two-run homer for the Dodgers.
The Dodgers held the Padres to seven hits and extended their scoreless streak to 15 innings.
Evan Phillips retired Jurickson Profar, Manny Machado, and Jackson Merrill on five pitches in the sixth inning.
Fernando Tatis Jr. was kept in the yard after hitting three homers in the first three games.
Ryan Brasier struck out Fernando Tatis Jr. in the first inning, his first strikeout in six playoff games.
Mookie Betts drove a 3-2 pitch into the Padres' bullpen for a home run.
Pre-Game Insights: Manny Machado emphasized the importance of leaving everything on the field.
The winner will have home-field advantage in the National League Championship Series against the New York Mets.
The Padres are expected to send Yu Darvish to the mound for Game 5, who dominated L.A. in his Sunday NLDS start.
Post-Match Reflections: Dylan Cease expressed that he felt comfortable and ready for the start despite the outcome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Petco Park-record crowd of 47,773 had hoped to see the Padres eliminate the Dodgers in the NLDS.
Freddie Freeman was sidelined by a right ankle sprain.
Shohei Ohtani was thrown out trying to score from second base in the fourth inning.
